page.title: 12TRADE
page.content: In a survey of where people shopped, we found that 73% shopped in Gloucester, 22% in Tewkesbury and 5% in Cheltenham. Of the three main supermarkets in Gloucester, we found that 40% went to Tesco's, and 30% each to Sainsbury's and Asda. There are two village shops: the Post Office Stores and Jakeman's. Most people do some of their shopping there. A mobile shop operates round the area. A man also comes with fresh fish and vegetables. A fish & chip van comes to Jubilee Place on Wednesday evenings. People can buy vegetables at two market gardens. There are two garages which most people use for petrol and repairs as well as buying gas and coal there. Three coal merchants deliver coal in this area. There is also a small garden centre which sells trees, shrubs and plants.
